page.title: 06LAND COVER
page.content: APART FROM THE SETTLEMENTS, APPROXIMATELY FIFTY PER CENT OF THE BLOCK IS FARMED, COMPRISING CULTIVATED LAND AND GRASSLAND. WOODLAND AND MOORLAND COVER ALMOST ALL OF THE REMAINDER. THE WOODLAND IS MOSTLY NATURAL DECIDUOUS, AND THERE ARE FOUR SMALL CONIFEROUS PLANTATIONS WHICH INCLUDE THE PLANTING ROUND THE RESERVOIR AT LOCKWOOD BECK. THE RESERVOIR IS SUPPLIED BY WATER DRAINED DOWN FROM THE MOOR, AND USED TO BE SUFFICIENT TO SUPPLY THE WHOLE OF EAST CLEVELAND; NOW IT IS ONLY USED TO SUPPLEMENT A LARGER RESERVOIR. THE MOORLAND IS UPLAND HEATHER-DOMINATED MOORLAND USED FOR SHEEP-GRAZING AND GROUSE SHOOTING. AROUND THE SETTLEMENTS, PARTICULARLY AT MARGROVE PART AND CHARLTON, SOME LAND IS USED FOR ALLOTMENTS, WHERE VEGETABLES ARE GROWN AND PIGS, GOATS AND POULTRY KEPT
